entry.title: SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT , Rocky Harbour
entry.summary: Persons in or near this area should be on the lookout for adverse weather conditions and take necessary safety precautions. Issued: 11:05 AM NST Wednesday 01 February 2023

entry.title: Wednesday: Chance of flurries. High minus 7. POP 40%
entry.summary: Mainly cloudy. 40 percent chance of flurries early this afternoon. Flurries and local snow squalls beginning this afternoon. Local amount 2 cm. Wind becoming west 20 km/h gusting to 40 this afternoon. High minus 7. Wind chill near minus 16. UV index 1 or low. Forecast issued 11:00 AM NST Wednesday 01 February 2023

entry.title: Wednesday night: Flurries or snow squalls. Low minus 15 except minus 11 along parts of the coast.
entry.summary: Flurries. Local snow squalls this evening. Local amount 2 cm. Wind northwest 20 km/h becoming light near midnight. Low minus 15 except minus 11 along parts of the coast. Wind chill minus 14 this evening and minus 21 overnight. Forecast issued 11:00 AM NST Wednesday 01 February 2023

entry.title: Thursday: Flurries. High minus 5.
entry.summary: Flurries. Risk of snow squalls in the afternoon. Amount 2 to 4 cm. Wind becoming southwest 30 km/h gusting to 50 near noon. High minus 5. Wind chill minus 21 in the morning and minus 13 in the afternoon. Forecast issued 11:00 AM NST Wednesday 01 February 2023
